noun.description: The practice of training people to obey rules or a code of behavior, using punishment to correct disobedience.
examples: a lack of proper parental and school discipline

noun.description: A branch of knowledge, typically one studied in higher education.
examples: sociology is a fairly new discipline

verb.description: Train (someone) to obey rules or a code of behavior, using punishment to correct disobedience.
examples: many parents have been afraid to discipline their children

origin: Middle English (in the sense mortification by scourging oneself): via Old French from Latin disciplina instruction, knowledge, from discipulus (see disciple).
